data.message: Has anyone had the problem where you are unable to scroll in the workstation? Let me know if you found a solution!

I'm sorry, I looked this up last night and then got distracted before I posted!

This blog post and screenshots look a lot like what was happening on your machine: http://blog.brunobraga.net/anyone-annoyed-by-the-eclipse-scrollbars-issue-in-ubuntu-11-04/

So it looks like it is worth trying entering:

echo “export LIBOVERLAY_SCROLLBAR=0″ >> /etc/X11/Xsession.d/80overlayscrollbars

at terminal (one line), and then logging out and back back.
Can someone tell me what the function is_field does, or give me an example of how it would be used?  Thanks!
You can use is_field to test whether a line starts with a given bit of text, e.g., "post:", "comment:" or "from:" (the different "fields"). Note that it is case sensitive.

so would I manually type the field I'm testing against as field_name, and then send the function the first item in the string as s? Then would I use that call in an if statement that is dependent on the boolean value of the return value?
This will work, though you are doing some extra work if you are passing it just the first item (note the line if "s[:len(field_name)] == field_name:")
I'm not sure I follow.  If I pass it an entire line will it compare every string with the same amount of characters as the field_name to the actual field_name?
yes
Ok thanks!  I think I'll need to catch up with you in class today.  I appreciate it!
Sean, please consider modify this function to "return s.startswith(field_name)", which is more elegant and easier to comprehend.
Tristan - pedagogically, it's sometimes advantageous to limit example code to methods that we've discussed in class.
(but I appreciate sharing other ways to accomplish the same)
I thought the P1: Adding value to data homework was due before class today and I was trying to submit it but it gives no option on canvas to "submit." Is the homework actually due next week?
Its due on the 27th :)
Glad to see I wasn't the only one who just realized this haha.
Sabrina - thanks, fixed! (and actually due next week)

I'm having an issue creating the dinosaurs dictionary in part 6 where it includes the other two dictionaries. Any help on adding dictionaries together (or guidance if this is totally the wrong direction)?
One thing that may help here is to remember that the value for a dictionary item can be any other type - a list, a string, an integer, or another dictionary.
One tip is that the default value of the get method is not limited to string/int/float etc. Am I saying too much? lol

I have a question for #5 from hw4-exercises. When we save the dictionary to a CSV file, should we manually create a blank CSV file first, then open it, then write into it or should we create the file as part of the code we write? Thanks!
I think we should create the file as part of the code. I think whether or not the CSV file exists, if we write into a file python will create the file if it doesn't exist.
Yup - if you ask Python to open a file that does not exist for writing, it will create it.
Thanks Kevin Huynh and Sean Munson ! Since we are not given an example of output for #5. Do we need a line break between each key and value? I attach my output here. Is this the expected output?

Hi - there should be line breaks between each entry, but not between the keys and values in each pair.

e.g.,
a,1
b,2
c,3

QUESTION: What is the explanation behind the random 8 for the output for part 4 of the homework. I AM CURIOUS. So is Stephanie Grose.
We must know.
I have a 3 at the top, and so does Perry, but in the document it's an 8.
We are also getting "- -" as a word, which shouldn't be the case.

I looked back at the code; I apparently did not have enough coffee when I wrote the solutions file.

I added a "-" to stripWordPunctuation in my solutions but didn't put that change back in the HW file. This difference does not matter for your homework - you can remove "-" or not.

Thanks Sean!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HmoNaTSXPMA

FYI, I imported the string module and used its constant "string.punctuation" instead of the provided string of punctuations. Also, empty strings being a word can be eliminated by simply adding a if statement.

Hey everyone,

I've spent quite a bit of time trying to figure out Part 3 of HW3, and am kinda going in circles. I feel like I just need a nudge in the right direction, so if someone could point me towards which slide deck/slides they used to help them get the strategy to solve that part it would be super helpful! Thanks!

Hi Stephanie - For counting, we can assume that each time a name appears after "from:", they posted or commented, which saves us some work. From part 2, you're already able to isolate the names of posters/commenters, so the next challenge is just counting them up.

It may help to think of each poster as similar to a "word" and to count their post frequencies similar to counting word frequencies (slides at the end of the Dictionaries lecture, around #97). Unlike counting the number of times a word appears, though, we want to count the number of times a poster appears.
For some reason my code prints the name on one line and the count on the next line. Do you have any idea why that may be?
Nevermind, I think I forgot to use strip()! :)

Is anyone else having issues with Eclipse dumping all of their open files/projects whenever it's been closed for a while? I'm extremely frustrated with having to reset everything over and over.

Sean, if you see this  - yes, it happened again today. Any other ideas?

Thanks

I spent a while reading on this last night, and nothing clearly jumped out as the likely culprit. 

One suggestion that came up on Stack Overflow (http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7389898/eclipse-all-my-projects-disappeared-from-project-explorer) was to check to see that all of your projects are selected:

"When this happened to me I had somehow set the Project Explorer to only display Working Sets. I had none, so nothing was displayed.

To fix it, I went to the Project Explorer View Menu (next to the Minimize and Maximize icons in the Project Explorer), Top Level Elements -> Projects."

If it's still giving you trouble, Chia-Fang Chung or I might replace your virtual machine tomorrow in class (we should be able to do most of it during the group exercise, so hopefully it will not take more of your time) with a clean install.
Just a heads up - for those of you with overlapping classes, tomorrow's class is a good one to be on time for, since we have an in-class activity.

Hi, some of you chose the free trial of the Assembla professional plan, instead of a free repository plan, when you created an Assembla account earlier. If you did, you might find the trial is expiring soon. 
To cancel the plan and prevent from future charges, please go to Account page by clicking your name at the top-right menu bar->Account. Then click on "Cancel Your Plan" at the bottom of the Account page. In the following pages, you'll need to select a reason for canceling the plan and leave some comments (It won't let you cancel if you don't input anything). After that, you should be able to cancel the plan and continue to use the free repository.
Hi Chia-Fang, this is how it looks like on my screen and I can't find the place to cancel it. Thanks.
Hi Jessica, that means you haven't subscribed to a plan. It should revert back to the free repository plan once the trial is over. Let me know if itdoesn't and we can work on something else.
Thanks Christina~!

data.message: HW3 clarification: In exercise 8, the PDF has an entry for hippo but your output won't.
For HW 2- Part 3 I'm getting the line count and the word count correct, but my character count is off.
What are you getting on the test file -- are you over? Under?
I'm getting 3,936 characters
on test.txt?
oh, sorry! it's 16.

No problem, just easier to debug with the smaller file :-)

I'm pretty sure that your program is counting the characters with spaces removed (e.g., by splitting each line into words and adding characters in each line). There are two spaces and three lines breaks that account for the missing five characters.
Oh! That helped a lot! I figured it out, thank you. :)
Wait just to check, are we supposed to count new line characters in our final output or no?
Nvm, I just saw my answer on the turn in page.
Either is okay -- 4754 if you keep them in, 4714 if you drop them. But definitely include the spaces.
can someone direct me to the slides on the find() function?
i cant seem to find it

string.find(s, sub[, start[, end]])
Return the lowest index in s where the substring sub is found such that sub is wholly contained in s[start:end]. Return -1 on failure. Defaults for start and end and interpretation of negative values is the same as for slices.
https://canvas.uw.edu/courses/916351/files/28661769/, slide 27
its on the supplement 2 slides, slide 27!
thank you!

an observation: exercise 6a says case should not matter but my output suggests otherwise. i tried 'tiger' in my find function and i didnt get the 9 at the end of the loop, but when i put 'Tiger' both showed up...
I think it means you should write your code so that it finds tiger either way
For 6a, you should write code so that case does not matter.
Nitaya beat me to it.
For HW 2, I'm having a hard time replacing the element of lst whose value is 3 with the value 'three'. I keep getting this error. Not sure what I'm doing wrong!

Hi Sami - Python doesn't have a replace method for lists, only strings. For this exercise, you can just overwrite 3 with three (since you know its position). 

If you didn't know the position, you could iterate through the list, checking whether the current item is 3 and keeping track of your position, replacing that item with "three" when it is equal.

There are some other ways to handle this in python that we'll cover ina  couple of weeks too.
Oh okay! Thanks.

Part 4 is just the posts (not comments)

For today's class challenge, if you ran both lower casing and punctuation removal, you should end up with "the" appearing 5798 times.

Which, btw, is not a very interesting result -- so it is common when doing text analysis to remove or ignore common words ("stopwords"). There are lots of lists available online, including http://www.ranks.nl/stopwords and http://www.lextek.com/manuals/onix/stopwords1.html.

There is also a Python package of stopwords at https://pypi.python.org/pypi/stop-words/2014.5.26

Here are the instructions http://www.tomshardware.com/faq/id-1957309/install-virtualbox-guest-additions-linux-mint.html

Ahh I don't exactly know and I forgot that some people are using Workstation. In that case, you might have to ask Sean
No worries, thanks for your help anyway! At least you gave me an alternate route to go if I can't find a solution for Workstation. :)

The link Perry posted works on VirtualBox. It won't work on VMWare (Fusion or Workstation), where the VMWare drivers aren't quite caught up with what Mint is using.  So it depends on what you're running. 

If you're on Windows and Workstation is slow, the best thing seems to be disabling debug mode (see earlier post about this).  An alternative is installing VirtualBox and the guest addition.

If you're on OS X, Fusion is the way to go, though could also try VirtualBox + guest additions on OS X.
Ok cool. I've disabled debug mode already, and it works well enough. I was just wondering if I could get it snappier. I'll probably check out VirtualBox after this next assignment is done.
Can anyone tell me how to open the Mint desktop? When I run Fusion it only opens the terminal view.  Thanks!
If it's booting to the CLI, you can login with the same username and password (me, hcde310) and then typing starx should bring up the GUI.

Hrm. And also the git pull command from ~/System?

okay, now I'm out of easy ideas -- going to try to reproduce it on my machine

What's the output of
ls ~/System/hcde310a14/homeworks
and
ls ~/System/hcde310a14/homeworks/hw1
on your machine?

The first confirms there is a directory.
The second says there is no such directory.

Apparently, the hw1 folder was created in ~/Homeworks and not within the System folder
what's in  ~/System/hcde310a14/homeworks? hw0 only?
first_program.py

I *think* something your SVN repository is corrupted in some way, but I'm not sure how. It's probably easiest to replace it by running the following commands in Terminal:

cd ~/System
rm -r hcde310a14
svn checkout https://subversion.assembla.com/svn/hcde310a14/
cd ~
./getHW.sh 
./getHW.sh 1

(the first getHW.sh is necessary to get the lecture files back, the second should get hw1)
It works! Thank you

If you're using VirtualBox (rather than VMWare Workstation), installing the VirtualBox Guest Additions improves performance, by quite a bit on some machines. The process is at http://www.tomshardware.com/faq/id-1957309/install-virtualbox-guest-additions-linux-mint.html

(If you are using Workstation or Fusion, the virtual machine image was distributed with the equivalent VMWare Tools already installed)

Because of the SVN issues, we've slightly changed our process for distributing lectures and solutions - you can update the scripts we use for that by typing the following lines in terminal:

cd ~/System
git pull 

(this may open a window, just type control-X)

cd ~

After that any time you run ./getHW.sh, it will update lectures and solutions (but you may still have to right click the folder and select "Refresh" in Eclipse). Thanks to Korn and Mia for helping us catch this problem early.

Hi Windows users -- sorry for the trouble today, but we've found a workaround. 

Download Workstation 11 (the technology preview) from https://communities.vmware.com/community/vmtn/workstation/vmware-workstation-technology-preview-2014

This should be freely available until January 2015, at which point it will go in the store and you can get a "free" license for a year.

data.message:
SUCCESS on Windows 7 64-bit! It runs VERY slow (so slow you can't see what you type), but it technically works. The trick is to (1) clicks Ok to everything Windows warns about and (2) wait until you see a desktop before doing anything (takes ~4 minutes for me).

Step-by-step of my process if anyone needs it:

Used the non-zipped version of the class files (waited for it in class) so did not have to unzip.

Had to register for a free VMWare account.

Used the physical address for the HCDE department as my company (mandatory) taken from http://www.hcde.washington.edu/contact-us

3960 Benton Lane NE
University of Washington
Seattle, WA 98195 

Downloaded the File where Information says "Vmware Workstation Technical Preview July 2014 for Windows
Product installation including VMware Tools for Windows Operating Systems."

Took ~10 minutes to download.

Installed.

Had to uninstall the VMWare player I installed while in class.

Installer asked 3 times if I wanted to allow installation. Said yes every time.

Asked me to enter Installation Key. Said Skip.

Installation took ~5 minutes.

Started the VMPlayer.

Loaded and played the virtual machine (.vmdk file) into the player.

Alert popped up: "Binary translation is incompatible with long mode on this platform. Long mode will be disabled in this virtual environment and applications requiring long mode will not function properly as a result. See http://vmware.com/info?id=152 for more details."

I clicked Ok.

Alert popped up: "You are running this virtual machine with debugging enabled. Debugging performs extra error checking to help diagnose problems, but it also lowers performance."

I clicked Ok.

Alert popped up: "This virtual machine might have been moved or copied. In order to configure certain management and networking features, VMware Player needs to know if this virtual machine was moved or copied. If you don't know, answer "I Copied It"."

I clicked "I copied it".

Windows only shows a green graphics in the middle. 

I clicked ALT-TAB and discovered there were 2 windows open on top of each other (maybe it opens 2 windows always...).

It took ~2 minutes to load.

Finally, I landed n a graphical login screen (similar to a Windows login screen, not the text login).

I entered my name.
 
It prompted me to enter a password but I switched windows to type this documentation. When I returned, it had logged me into a desktop. Maybe typing in my text editor program also typed it into VMWare? Oops.

Inside the desktop, it runs too slow to use.

At the top of the VMPlayer, is a icon that looks like a "Pause" symbol. Clicked that and under, clicked "Restart Guest".

Again, only agreen icon appeared. I clicked ALT-TAB to see Linux Mint starting.

~5 minutes later, back in the desktop without having to login this time.

Opened Terminal.

Entered Python program successfully.

It runs annoyingly slow but works.

The VM is set up to auto-login after a few seconds, but the username is "me" and password is "hcde310"

Turning off debug mode might improve the performance; there's a thread on VMWare's site: https://communities.vmware.com/thread/484066

I found directions that worked on a link I found via the link above: https://communities.vmware.com/thread/448058 (again, my computer has a 64-bit processor so files were in a "x64" folder. Startup time is about the same but the desktop and terminal run much faster. This will work. Thanks!

Here's what I did:

Rename
C:\Program Files (x86)\VMware\VMware Player\x64\vmware-vmx-debug.exe
to
C:\Program Files (x86)\VMware\VMware Player\x64\vmware-vmx-debug.exe_ORIGINAL

Rename
C:\Program Files (x86)\VMware\VMware Player\vmware-remotemks-debug.exe
to
C:\Program Files (x86)\VMware\VMware Player\vmware-remotemks-debug.exe_ORIGINAL

Copy and rename
C:\Program Files (x86)\VMware\VMware Player\x64\vmware-vmx.exe
to
C:\Program Files (x86)\VMware\VMware Player\x64\vmware-vmx-debug.exe

Copy and rename
C:\Program Files (x86)\VMware\VMware Player\x64\vmware-remotemks.exe
to
C:\Program Files (x86)\VMware\VMware Player\x64\vmware-remotemks-debug.exe
Thanks for sharing the trouble -- and sharing the workaround. Hopefully it will save others some trouble

Fail. The version of the VMware I downloaded above prompted me for a license or to use a 30 day trial. Since our class will last longer than 30 days, that won't help. My current plan is to install my own web server and Python instances, rather than keep working with VMware.
Oi....except that I need Linux running probably?
Maybe I will subscribe to Digital Ocean or Linode, use their pre-made images to install Linux and then install Python, if necessary.

Linux isn't necessary. We use the virtual machine because we've had horrible problems in past years with students running different Python versions with different installs.

If you are using workstation 11, the download page has a license key good through January 2015.

If you go the non VMware route, the main things are to stick with Python 2.7.x (anything in 2.7 should be fine, we use 2.7.4 when we write sample code, write homeworkers, and grade homeworks). You'll also simplify your life greatly if you install eclipse (or another IDE) that will sync with an SVN repository.

Had already uninstalled the VMware requiring the key. Re-installed and used key successfully. I assume this can be used with an already existing installation, too. For reference, key is M50AC-J034J-08L8A-03ARM-3D14A (expires January 15, 2015). Working now.
I decided to to install everything natively on my Mac. Can someone tell me the repo so that I can get "first_program.py"?
Hi Tristan, you should be able to use this url to get homework files: https://subversion.assembla.com/svn/hcde310a14/homeworks/
Why do I have lecture 5 instead of lecture 2? As the image attached, does this means that I finished part7 in HW0? Thanks!
Yes you did. The s2 means you got lecture 2 and the 5 is just the version of it.
Thank you!
I had this question too! Thanks for the reassurance!

So I got everything up and running on my laptop. However, my laptop is rocking some pretty old specs and things are running really slowly and I thought I would ask if we could just install eclipse and pydev and cut VM out of the equation.

That's fine - you'll also want to set up SVN to check out the homework and lecture code (you can download the files directly, but SVN is easier in the long run), and try to stay with python 2.7 (otherwise some of the examples / assignments may fail or behave differently)

Hello everyone! It seems the program system runs pretty slow on Mac since the memory space is just 512 MB. Here is my way to change the memory space: first, you need to shut down your Mint System, then click the virtual machine button on the top bar, find and open the Settings menu under it, then you can find the memory settings in here and change that!
I am having trouble finding the How To document "Unix commands." Does anyone know where it is?

Sorry!

https://canvas.uw.edu/courses/916351/files/28551661/
(Canvas --> Files --> Documentation)
Thank you!

This also helped me:
http://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Unix_commands
"In Eclipse, on the left side, right-click on the "lectures" project, select Team > Update." This left side doesn't seem to exist...help?
Hi Kendall, what does eclipse look like when it loads for you?  There should be a pydev package explorer window open on the left. Thanks.
Found it, my minimized view hid some of the screens but it worked after I closed them out!
Hi guys, here you have a link to drive for those of you who failed to copy or copied a corrupted version of the file. https://drive.google.com/folderview?id=0B3NHAFY3OrsHN0ZfU0dGUUFkUEU&usp=sharing

Can someone help me out with downloading VMWare Fusion? I'm not sure what I'm doing wrong.
What do you have? Mac or Windows?
Mac
are you in the onthehub website?
Yeah, I already "purchased" and pressed download. I just need help with the installation part of it I guess. It's telling me "no operating system found."
I have a windows computer so I guess those steps are different, sorry I can't help you with that. Good luck, hopefully a mac user will help you soon.
Hi Sami - can you post a screenshot of the error message or describe where in the process it is giving you the error? Thanks!
and then after it shows this, something will pop up and say no operating system found. i'm so confused!
Hrm. What happens if you close this and start the virtual machine by double clicking on the .vmx file (which was in the zip file)?
Oh, it works now! haha. Thanks. :)
Hooray :)
If you are still unable to get the file copied, email us and let us know whether you are using Mac or Windows, we'll try to pass the usb around.
